thread.title: Expect delays on I-405 throughout weekend
thread.title_full: Expect delays on I-405 throughout weekend | The Seattle Times

author: Mike Lindblom
title: Expect delays on I-405 throughout weekend
text:
Drivers on northbound Interstate 405 will cram into just one lane this weekend from Totem Lake to Highway 522, as the state prepares to open a new Bothell interchange Monday .
Drivers are urged to travel very early, very late, or some other day.
Workers will set barriers and lane stripes for bypass ramps serving Northeast 160th Street and Highway 522, to separate exiting cars from the mainline. Travelers to downtown Bothell, Woodinville or Monroe will leave I-405 two miles earlier than before, instead of weaving downhill in mainline traffic. The state built similar ramps from downtown Bellevue to Highway 520 three years ago.
The pinch lasts from 11 p.m. Friday until 5 a.m. Monday. It will disrupt travel from Eastside suburbs to the Evergreen State Fair in Monroe.
Most Read Stories Mariners fire general manager Jack Zduriencik Now comes the hard part for the Mariners: Hiring Jack Zduriencik’s replacement Mariners demote struggling catcher Mike Zunino Why Russell Wilson needs to water down his Recovery claims Animated map: How the wildfires in North Central Washington have grown over time The I-405 northbound exits to 160th and Highway 522 will be closed, and drivers won’t be able to enter I-405 northbound from 160th.
Detour options include Highway 522 through Kenmore, around the north end of Lake Washington.
Meanwhile, crews will install equipment and paint lane stripes in Kirkland for new I-405 Express Toll Lanes, to open Sept. 27. These allow solo drivers to pay a toll , projected at $4 in heavy commute traffic, to travel 45 mph between Lynnwood and Bellevue.
Carpools of at least three people at peak times, and two people off-peak, can enter these lanes for free using a newer-model Good2Go Flex Pass, which switches between carpool and solo mode.
The Washington State Department of Transportation wanted motorists to get accustomed to the new Bothell ramps, expected to carry 30,000 vehicles daily, a few weeks before the complicated toll startup.
Related: Several I-5 exits in Tacoma to close over weekend for construction
